body:

title: Force character encoding of the form to be utf8.
body:
## Purpose

All our encoding assumes UTF8 strings, so to use special characters as names we need the verifier's form to have UTF8 encoding, otherwise special characters can get garbled.

## Checklist

- [ ] My code follows the style of this project.
- [ ] The code compiles without warnings.
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of the changes.
- [ ] I have documented my code, in particular the intent of the
      hard-to-understand areas.
- [ ] (If necessary) I have updated the CHANGELOG.

title: Check denominator when deserializing TimeoutParameters
body:
## Purpose

Partly fixes https://github.com/Concordium/concordium-base/issues/327 by checking the denominators when deserializing the `TimeoutParameters`.


## Changes

Introduced two checks that make sure that we fail properly if the provided denominator of either the `timeoutIncrease` or `timeoutDecrease` are zero.

title: Introduce Ratio type and add p6 variants to UpdatePayload and UpdateType
body:
## Purpose

Update types to support protocol version 6.
Depends on https://github.com/Concordium/concordium-contracts-common/pull/85.
Related to https://github.com/Concordium/concordium-rust-sdk/pull/92

## Changes

- Introduce `Ratio` struct for implementing serde and the serialization of the node.
- Extend enums `UpdatePayload` and `UpdateType` with variants introduced in protocol version 6.

title: Web3id key derivation
body:
## Purpose
Add support for deriving keys for verifiable credentials. In particular also expose this functionality to the mobile libraries for when they are going to implement Web3 ID functionality.

## Changes
- Updated `key_derivation` with methods for getting the public key, signing key and encryption key required for a verifiable credential.
- Updated mobile libraries to expose the new functionality in `key_derivation`.

title: Infrastructure for Web3ID proofs.
body:
Define proofs and requests, did methods.

## Purpose

Implement the core prover and verifier for Web3ID.

## Depends on

- [ ] https://github.com/Concordium/concordium-contracts-common/pull/86/

## Changes

- Add a parser for DID methods that will be supported.
- Add the request for proof and a "Presentation" format, with parsing and proving and verification functions.
- Generalize some of the ID2 functionality to allow more flexibility in what attribute tags can be.

Closes #366

title: Fix wasm test.
body:
The return value u64::MAX is returned when there is no next value for the iterator. u64::MAX with the second bit unset is returned in case of "error" (such as the iterator not existing).

title: New consensus implementation
body:
## Purpose

A number of small changes to support the new consensus implementation.

## Changes

- Deterministic key-pair generation for testing.

- Add the signature threshold to the core genesis parameters for consensus V1.

- Logging changes:

   - Add `Konsensus` as a log source.
 
- Extend the definition of `IsConsensusV1` to include that finalization committee parameters and delegation are supported

- Correct the definition of `emptyTransactionOutcomesHashV1` to align with how transaction outcomes hashes are computed. This does affect how the transaction outcomes hash of a genesis block is computed by the node. However, we never actually use the transaction outcomes hash of a genesis block (neither to compute the genesis block hash, nor exposing it via GRPC). As such, this is not a breaking change.

## Checklist

- [X] My code follows the style of this project.
- [X] The code compiles without warnings.
- [X] I have performed a self-review of the changes.
- [X] I have documented my code, in particular the intent of the
      hard-to-understand areas.
- [ ] (If necessary) I have updated the CHANGELOG.

title: Restructure rust src
body:
## Purpose

Addresses part of #335 

## Changes

- Rename `crypto_common_derive` to `concordium_base_derive`
- Move all remaining crates apart from
  - ed25519_hd_key_derivation
  - key_derivation
  - keygen_bls
  - sha_2
  under `concordium_base`. Crates have become submodules in the concordium_base crate. No other changes to functionality or documentation were made in this PR apart from the necessary ones to make the new crates compile after changes to dependencies.

- Fix compilation of mobile_wallet, idiss, and identity-provider-service packages. They now all depend only on concordium-base.


## For reviewers

Due to many moves the diff is rather ugly. It might make sense to go through the commits instead since they are relatively self-contained operations.

## Checklist

- [ ] My code follows the style of this project.
- [ ] The code compiles without warnings.

title: Add helper methods and derive instances needed for integration testing
body:
## Purpose

Changes needed while implementing https://github.com/Concordium/concordium-smart-contract-tools/pull/23.

Depends on:
 - https://github.com/Concordium/concordium-contracts-common/pull/72

## Changes

- Add `saturating_sub` method to `InterpreterEnergy`.
- Derive `PartialEq`/`Eq` for `Logs` and `InvokeFailure`.
- Additions to `Energy` type:
  - Add helper methods to `Energy`: `checked_sub` and `tick_energy`.
  - Derive `Sub`.
- Add `InsufficientEnergy` type.
- Derive `PartialEq`/`Eq` to `ContractTraceElement`, `InstanceUpdatedEvent`, and `ContractEvent`.
- Add `size` (in bytes) methods to `InitContractPayload` and `UpdateContractPayload` types.
- Adds a Fibonacci contract written in wasm, which matches the API and behaviour of the one we have in the rust-smart-contracts repo.

## Checklist

- [x] My code follows the style of this project.
- [x] The code compiles without warnings.
- [x] I have performed a self-review of the changes.

title: New consensus leader election
body:
## Purpose

Revise the seed state with fields to support leader election in the new consensus version.

## Changes

- Rather than having fields `Conditionally`, `SeedState` is spit into constructors for different `SeedStateVersion`s.
- `SeedStateV1` removes `epochLength` and adds:
  - `triggerBlockTime`: the timestamp at or after which the trigger block for this epoch occurs.
  - `epochTransitionTriggered`: flag indicating if a trigger block has already been encountered for this epoch.
- Add a `hashToInteger` function for SHA256 hashes. This is used for leader election calculations.

## Checklist

- [X] The code compiles without warnings.
- [X] I have performed a self-review of the changes.

title: Revise core genesis parameters for new consensus protocol.
body:
## Purpose

The core genesis parameters define common parameters that are set at (re)genesis, but currently are specific to the old consensus. This introduces new core genesis parameters for the new consensus.

The genesis parameters for consensus version 0 are:
- genesis time
- slot duration
- epoch length (in slots)
- max block energy
- finalization parameters

The genesis parameters for consensus version 1 are:
- genesis time
- epoch duration (in ms)

As a consequence of this change, the `SeedState` (part of the block state), which currently includes the epoch length, must be versioned to remove the epoch length for the consensus version 1.

## Changes

- Introduce `CoreGenesisParametersV1` and `RegenesisDataV1` to replace `CoreGenesisParameters` and `RegenesisData` for the new consensus version. (BaseV1.hs)
- Rename `GenesisParameters` to `GenesisParametersV2` and introduce `GenesisParametersV3`. Add `BaseV1.parametersToState` for generating the genesis state for the new consensus version from genesis parameters.
- Tweak the genesis executable to support printing the new genesis version with the revised parameters.
- Refactor `Conditionally` to its own module.
- Parametrise `SeedState` by a new `SeedStateVersion`. `SeedStateVersion1` removes the `epochLength` that is present in `SeedStateVersion0`.
- Lift `IsConsensusV0` and `IsConsensusV1` to `Parameters`. Constraints on the seed state version are added to both definitions. `ConsensusVersion` and `consensusVersionFor` provide a way to obtain the constraints for a particular protocol version.

## Checklist

- [X] My code follows the style of this project.
- [X] The code compiles without warnings.
- [X] I have performed a self-review of the changes.

title: New parameters for deciding finalization committe eligibility
body:
## Purpose

Addresses https://github.com/Concordium/concordium-base/issues/303


## Changes

Added a new `FinalizationCommitteeParameters` structure for holding the parameters deciding which bakers gets to join the finalization committee for the new consensus protocol.

In particular it holds the following: 

- Minimum number of bakers that should reside in the finalization committee. `minFinalizers`
- Maximum number of bakers allowed to join the finalization committee. `maxFinalizers`
- A threshold that together with the total staked ccd constitutes the minimum stake requirement for joining the finalization committee.

- Added the corresponding update queue
- Added the associated update and update payload types
- Supporting the updated grpc2 api https://github.com/Concordium/concordium-grpc-api/pull/35

**The parameters are controlled by the same authorization that controls the pool parameters**
## Checklist

title: Allow duplicate requests as long as identities are not issued yet.
body:
## Purpose

Allow duplicate requests as long as we don't have id object issued yet.

Note that this does mean that two concurrent requests with the same IDP will mean that only one of the identity objects is going to be retained.

That could also be fixed, but it requires adding more hacks on top of the hacky database we have at the moment, so I choose not to do this. In any case, that was a problem already before.

title: Add token address string format.
body:
## Purpose

Add a text format for "token address", the full identifier of a token.

This is based on base58check encoding with version 2 to achieve the following
- comparing the first few and the last few characters should be sufficient in most cases to determine whether tokens are distinct.
- the format is short and copyable
- the address can never be confused with an account address since version is 2.

title: Add FFI functions for creating `ArInfo`, `IpInfo` and `GlobalContext` instances.
body:
## Purpose

This PR adds C ABI functions to the Rust codebase for constructing heap-allocated `ArInfo`, `IpInfo` and `GlobalContext` instances from their field values. It furthermore adds Haskell FFI bindings and wrappers for said functions. This is useful since the field values for instances of these are marshalled in the Node API, and this allows for creating heap-allocated copies of the instances from which the fields were extracted from - for instance in the client

## Changes
- Rust codebase:
  - `ar_info_create`, `ip_info_create` and `global_context_create`, 
- Haskell codebase:
  - Corresponding bindings an wrappers for the above.

title: Consensus chain parameters
body:
## Purpose

Introduce new chain parameters for supporting the new consensus protocol. We also adopt the [singletons library](https://hackage.haskell.org/package/singletons) and broadly use that where we have previously defined singletons directly.

Addresses https://github.com/Concordium/concordium-node/issues/638 together with
https://github.com/Concordium/concordium-node/pull/653 

## Changes

Changes to the parameters:
- Election difficulty is generalised to "consensus parameters". For <P6, this is just the election difficulty. For P6, this consists of:
  - Timeout parameters: Timeout base time, timeout increase factor, timeout decrease factor.
  - Minimum block time.
  - Block energy limit.
- The consensus parameters are updatable with the same keys as for the election difficulty:
  - The access structure `asParamElectionDifficulty` is renamed to `asParamConsensusParameters`.
  - For JSON serialization of the level 2 authorizations, `electionParameters` is still used. This is to maintain compatibility, and since the old GRPC API is deprecated.
  - (It is renamed to `parameter_consensus` in the GRPC2 API. Renaming does not break binary compatibility.)
  - Each of the three new consensus parameters is updatable independently, though with the same keys.
- The GAS reward for including finalization proofs has been removed.

Technical changes:
- Use the singletons library to construct the existing singletons for `ProtocolVersion`, `ChainParametersVersion`, `AccountVersion` and `TransactionOutcomesVersion`. Generally, the same interface is maintained, however:
  - The constructors of `SChainParametersVersion` are renamed, e.g. `SCPV0` to `SChainParametersV0`.
  - Where the `IsProtocolVersion` constraint is used, the module should use `{-# LANGUAGE MonoLocalBinds #-}` (or `TypeFamilies` or `GADTs`, which imply this) to avoid warnings.
- `JustForCPV1` is removed. It is replaced with two new types:
  - `Conditionally`, with constructors `CTrue` and `CFalse`, holds a value if the type-level boolean parameters is `True`.
  - `OParam`, with constructors `SomeParam` and `NoParam`, holds a value if the chain parameters version supports the given parameter type.
- A number of new versioning types that are dependent on `ChainParametersVersion` are introduced for fine-grained control of version specific parameters:
  - `MintDistributionVersion`:
    - `MintDistributionVersion0` (`ChainParametersV0`): supports mint per slot.
    - `MintDistributionVersion1` (`ChainParametersV1`, `ChainParametersV2`): does not support mint per slot.
  - `GASRewardsVersion`:
    - `GASRewardsVersion0` (`ChainParametersV0`, `ChainParametersV1`): supports GAS reward for finalization proofs.
    - `GASRewardsVersion1` (`ChainParametersV2`): does not support GAS reward for finalization proofs.
  - `CooldownParametersVersion`:
    - `CooldownParametersVersion0` (`ChainParametersV0`): baker cooldown specified in epochs.
    - `CooldownParametersVersion1` (`ChainParametersV1`, `ChainParametersV2`): baker and delegator cooldowns specified in seconds.
  - `PoolParametersVersion`:
    - `PoolParametersVersion0`: (`ChainParametersV0`): minimum stake for registering a baker.
    - `PoolParametersVersion1` (`ChainParametersV1`, `ChainParametersV2`):
      - passive commission rates
      - bounds on pool commission rates
      - minimum baker equity capital
      - leverage bound for a baker
  - `ConsensusParametersVersion`:
    - `ConsensusParametersVersion0` (`ChainParametersV0`, `ChainParametersV1`): election difficulty
    - `ConsensusParametersVersion1` (`ChainParametersV2`):
        - Timeout parameters
        - Minimum block time
        - Block energy limit
  - `AuthorizationsVersion`:
    - `AuthorizationsVersion0` (`ChainParametersV0`).
    - `AuthorizationsVersion1` (`ChainParametersV1`, `ChainParametersV2`): add access structures for cooldown parameters and time parameters.

## Checklist

- [X] My code follows the style of this project.
- [X] The code compiles without warnings.
- [x] I have performed a self-review of the changes.
- [X] I have documented my code, in particular the intent of the
      hard-to-understand areas.
- [ ] (If necessary) I have updated the CHANGELOG.

title: Support `maxEnergy` in the mobile wallet library.
body:
## Purpose

The wallet-proxy returns the total cost of the transaction. So it is more approriate that the mobile wallet library also supports that as an input.

## Changes

Add support for `maxEnergy` in addition to `maxContractExecutionEnergy` in the payload to init and update calls.

title: Mark functions that only apply to sending p1-p3 transactions as deprecated
body:
## Purpose

Make it less confusing to use baker related transactions in the rust SDK.

## Changes

Mark baker related transactions that only apply to P1-P3 as deprecated, and hide them from generated documentation.

title: Use hex encoding to display contract events and parameters.
body:
## Purpose

Part of https://github.com/Concordium/concordium-wallet-proxy/issues/73

## Changes

Use hex to display parameters and contract events using the Show instance. There is no advantage in the ugly `Parameter { ... }` display and this fixes a number of places in the client which have an ugly output.

title: Make CI build fail on warnings
body:
## Purpose

Make CI fail when encountering Haskell warnings
Related to https://github.com/Concordium/concordium-node/issues/606

## Changes

- Add ghc-option to fail on warnings.
- Fix the warnings in the haskell code.
- Make the build run after checking formatting.

title: Increase cost of exchange the rate query.
body:
## Purpose

Fixes https://github.com/Concordium/concordium-node/issues/600

## Changes

Increase the cost of the exchange rate query.

With this setting the worst execution time seems to be around 0.4s on the i12900. This is good enough.

body:
## Purpose

This will add the [`fourmolu`](https://github.com/fourmolu/fourmolu) Haskell code formatter.
Related to https://github.com/Concordium/concordium-node/issues/599

## Changes

- Add a config for formatting `fourmolu.yaml`
- Add CI job checking formatting on PRs.
- Update readme related to formatter for Haskell.
- Run formatter on code base.

title: Add RNG support to TestHost
body:

Extend `TestHost` with new host function that calls a RNG. The purpose of this is to run QuickCheck test for Wasm code that runs on-chain and doesn't support random number generation.
